exposr 0.0.1
  • Reference

Simulate Dose-Response Data from a Sigmoid Emax Model

Source: R/simulate_sigemax.R
simulate_sigmoid_emax.Rd
simulate_sigmoid_emax(
  dose_levels,
  n_per_dose,
  e0,
  emax,
  ed50,
  h,
  sigma = 0,
  dist = "normal",
  df = 3,
  seed = NULL
)

Arguments

dose_levels

Numeric vector of dose levels.

n_per_dose

Either a single integer (equal sample size per dose) or a vector matching `dose_levels`.

e0

Baseline effect. Can be a scalar or a vector.

emax

Maximum drug effect. Can be a scalar or a vector.

ed50

Dose producing 50

hHill coefficient. Can be a scalar or a vector.

sigmaStandard deviation for residual error.

distResidual error distribution: `"normal"` (default), `"lognormal"`, `"uniform"`, `"t"`, or `"gamma"`.

dfDegrees of freedom for t-distribution.

seedOptional seed for reproducibility.

Data frame with columns: `id`, `dose`, `pred`, `ipred`, `scenario` (combination label).

Simulates individual-level responses from a sigmoid Emax dose-response model: $$pred = e0 + emax * dose^h / (ed50^h + dose^h)$$

All combinations of `e0`, `emax`, `ed50`, and `h` will be simulated.
